Metadata.Name: Report of Controlled Substances Examination
Metadata.Summary: The Report of Controlled Substances Examination IEPD was developed for the California Department of Justice - Data Exchange Project.
Metadata.Description: A Report of Controlled Substances Examination is sent from the Sheriff to the Prosecutor if the lab analyzes evidence for controlled substance related to a pending case. The report details the lab results related to controlled substances. The Prosecutor in turn informs the Public Defender of the lab results. . The Report of Controlled Substances Examination contains lab information, description of the evidence, examination results, and a signature block. The Report of Controlled Substances Examination is one of 44 IEPDs developed by the California Department of Justice - Data Exchange Project to support information exchange between state and local government organizations throughout the state of California. It could also be adapted for use in other states.
Metadata.Status: IEPD CntrlSubLabRpt complete and ready for implementation
Metadata.ExchangePartners: California state and local criminal justice agencies
Metadata.Process: If the lab analyzes evidence for controlled substances, the lab results are sent from the Sheriff to the Prosecutor and from the Prosecutor to the Public Defender.
Metadata.TriggeringEvent: Report of Controlled Substances Examination Complete
Metadata.Conditions: If the lab analyzes evidence for controlled substances.
Metadata.Sponsors: California Department of Justice and other California state and local criminal justice agencies - see master documentation
Metadata.Purpose: To inform the Prosecutor and Public Defender of lab results related to evidence in a pending case.
Metadata.ExchangePartnerCategories: California state and local criminal justice agencies
